content:
Diagnosis:	Muscle invasive bladder cancer (sarcomatoid variant)

Management:	15 Jan 2024 Radical cystoprostatectomy and pelvic lymph node dissection
		12 Feb - 20 Mar 2024 Adjuvant gemcitabine-cisplatin chemotherapy

Histology:	pT3b N1 (2/18 nodes) M0 sarcomatoid variant urothelial carcinoma
		NF1 mutation detected

Current Situation:	End of treatment review

I reviewed [redacted name] today following completion of 4 cycles of adjuvant gemcitabine-cisplatin chemotherapy. He has tolerated the treatment well with only grade 1 fatigue and occasional nausea well controlled with antiemetics. His surgical wounds have healed well and he is managing his ileal conduit independently. Performance status remains 0. Recent CT shows no evidence of disease recurrence. Blood tests show stable renal function with eGFR 65.

The plan is to arrange 3-monthly surveillance CT chest/abdomen/pelvis for the first year. He will be reviewed in clinic with scan results in 3 months' time. I have provided written information about signs and symptoms to watch for. He understands to contact us sooner if any concerns develop.
